channel.title: Rep ++ to anyone who can help
channel.description:
I just starting building my rsps and I am trying to make it so that the buy 10 button buys you 50, I have already made it so it does but I want to make it say buy 50 instead of buy 10. Any help would be great and I will give rep ++ if you can salve it.
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/29wxtl.jpg[/img]

item.title: Rep ++ to anyone who can help
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“x andrew x, post:3, topic:334498”][quote author=Spades link=topic=430900.msg3163522#msg3163522 date=1269801574]
That’d be client sided, search it in client.java in your client. If it isn’t there, in that file it is in one of them.
[/quote] Nope, I serched Client.java up and down for like 2 hours and found nothing at all.[/quote]
In class9, try adding this
Search this

class9.aStringArray225 = new String[5];

Under that, add this.

for(int j2 = 0; j2 < 5; j2++) { class9.aStringArray225[j2] = class30_sub2_sub2.method415(); if(class9.anInt236 == 3824) class9.aStringArray225[3] = "Buy 50"; if(class9.aStringArray225[j2].length() == 0) class9.aStringArray225[j2] = null; }

Read full topic
item.source: Rep ++ to anyone who can help

Already did there are no tuts out there for this.

[/quote] Nope, I serched Client.java up and down for like 2 hours and found nothing at all.[/quote]Look for a tutorial using the Search function ;).
